page.title: 12The Mosque
page.content: The Mosque I am talking about is half a mile away from the town centre and is in Snowden Street.It was built in January 1983 and has only one floor. There are five rooms.One for the toilets,one for keeping holy books in, one for keeping ladders etc. and one where we worship. We have,five times a day Namaz (worship).There is something like an exam every year.Everyone gets a prize.Our holy book is called Quran and it is written in Arabic which we read.Children come to pray.They pray between 5 p.m. until 7 p.m. and there are four classes and on Saturday's they come from 9 a.m. until 11 a.m. They do not go to Mosques on Sunday's. 30% of Batley's population are Muslims.There are three Mosques in the town altogether.
